intro: Trichomanes cristatum var. nudiusculum, commonly known as the naked spore fern, is a rare and delicate species belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant produces spores rather than seeds, and its reproductive structures are often hidden within the fronds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
